newsitem.title: UK: INSTANT VIEW - Market comments on British election.
newsitem.headline: INSTANT VIEW - Market comments on British election.

text.p: The following is a selection of analysts' reactions to exit polls for Britain's May 1 election pointing to a landslide victory for opposition Labour party.
For a full breakdown of election news - GB/ELEX
JEREMY HAWKINS, SENIOR ECONOMIC ADVISOR, BANK OF AMERICA
2115 GMT - "The main thing is the market wants to see a majority...the first round impact is relief that we're not going to get either a very small majority or a hung parliament.

"If these polls actually translate into actual numbers then very quickly markets are going to want to see (Labour leader) Tony Blair put his money where his mouth is -- they'll need to show some kind of policy credibility very quickly in terms of a hike in the base rate and ideally a tight budget as well"
STEVE SCOTT, GILTS ANALYST, DRESDNER KLEINWORT BENSON
2115 GMT - "I've got a feeling the market is going to find it difficult to distinguish between a majority of 100 or 150, just as long as any fear of a hung parliament has vanished."
